explains: n. 强迫，胁迫；高压政治，威压

sentences.en: He claimed he had only acted under coercion.
sentences.cn: 他声称他只是受了胁迫才采取了行动。

sentences.en: They cast their votes freely and without coercion on election day.
sentences.cn: 他们在选举日自由地投票，不受强迫。

sentences.en: It was vital that the elections should be free of coercion or intimidation.
sentences.cn: 至关重要的是，选举中不得有胁迫或威逼。
